configuration-parameters.name: autocommit
configuration-parameters.description: The autocommit mode. If set to ON, all changes to a table take effect immediately. If set to OFF, you must use COMMIT to accept a transaction or ROLLBACK to cancel it.

configuration-parameters.name: auto_increment_increment
configuration-parameters.description: auto_increment_increment and auto_increment_offset are intended for use with master-to-master replication, and can be used to control the operation of AUTO_INCREMENT columns.

configuration-parameters.name: auto_increment_offset
configuration-parameters.description: auto_increment_increment and auto_increment_offset are intended for use with master-to-master replication, and can be used to control the operation of AUTO_INCREMENT columns.

configuration-parameters.name: back_log
configuration-parameters.description: The number of outstanding connection requests MySQL can have. This comes into play when the main MySQL thread gets very many connection requests in a very short time. It then takes some time (although very little) for the main thread to check the connection and start a new thread. The back_log value indicates how many requests can be stacked during this short time before MySQL momentarily stops answering new requests. The default value depends on system architecture.
